to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

30.brief: to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
drink, by implication, drinking (the act); also (by implication) a banquet or (generally) feast

31.brief: literally, to load up (on the back of man or beast), i.e. to start early in the morning
properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning
to seven oneself, i.e. swear (as if by repeating a declaration seven times)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
a brother (used in the widest sense of literal relationship and metaphorical affinity or resemblance (like father))
to send away, for, or out (in a great variety of applications)
to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
safe, i.e. (figuratively) well, happy, friendly; also (abstractly) welfare, i.e. health, prosperity, peace

32.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)

properly, to front, i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to manifest; figuratively, to announce (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to expose, predict, explain, praise
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
properly, to pry into; by implication, to delve, to explore
properly, to come forth to, i.e. appear or exist; transitively, to attain, i.e. find or acquire; figuratively, to occur, meet or be present
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen

33.brief: to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that

34.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
Esav, a son of Isaac, including his posterity
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
a year (as a revolution of time)
to take (in the widest variety of applications)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
Beeri, the name of a Hittite and of an Israelite
a Chittite, or descendant of Cheth
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Bosmath, the name of a wife of Esau, and of a daughter of Solomon
a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
Elon, the name of a place in Palestine, and also of one Hittite, two Israelites
a Chittite, or descendant of Cheth

35.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
